title: Nigel Farage Says Reform UK Won't Save Worried Tory Politicians
summary: Nigel Farage, the leader of Reform UK, says his party is not a rescue charity for scared Conservative MPs. He wrote in a newspaper that Reform won't help Tory politicians who want to join just to save their jobs. Farage says any Tory who wants to join must admit that the previous Conservative government broke the country and believe in Reform's values like family and community. Recently, about 20 former Conservative MPs have joined Reform, but critics say Reform is becoming a home for failed Tories instead of a new force. Farage has said Reform won't accept more defectors after local elections on May 7. Reform's deputy leader, Richard Tice, said a former Tory MP, Robert Jenrick, is a great new asset with experience. There are rumors that a well-known Labour figure might join Reform next week, but it's not confirmed. Some people think defectors could cause power struggles in Reform, with Jenrick possibly becoming shadow chancellor.

background_read: In the UK, there are different political parties like the Conservative Party and Labour Party. Reform UK is a newer party led by Nigel Farage. Sometimes, politicians switch parties, which is called defecting. This article talks about how Reform UK is dealing with Tory MPs who want to join, with Farage saying they must believe in Reform's values and not just use it as a rescue. Local elections are coming up where people vote for local leaders, and this affects political decisions.
